turns.content: This is Agent Thomas Mitchell from the IRS. I'm calling about an outstanding tax violation for Walter Thompson. Are you the same Walter Thompson?

Yes, that's me. What kind of violation are they talking about? I always try to pay my taxes on time.
Agent, this can't be right. I file all my returns and have never been late with payments. Can you tell me more about what's going on?
Wait a minute, my wife needs to know about this too. She'll want to hear what you're saying.

Hold on, Mr. Thompson. This is serious. Your tax records show unpaid taxes from the last two years, totaling $4850. If we don't resolve this immediately, there will be an immediate arrest warrant issued for your arrest within the hour.
Listen carefully. There's a way to clear this up right now by purchasing a series of gift cards that total exactly $4850 and giving me the numbers over the phone so I can validate them quickly. That'll stop everything and keep you out of jail.
Do you understand what needs to happen? You only have 30 minutes left before our officers are dispatched to your address.

Wait, hold on a minute. This is all very odd. We've never missed paying taxes before. Let me just confirm this with my wife first. I think there's been some mistake here.
Hang on one second please. My wife will be right here and we'll figure out what to do next. She can help me understand this better, okay?

Mr. Thompson, we don't have time for that. This is a straightforward process designed to protect you from legal trouble. If you're unsure or need to check with your spouse, then I suggest doing it quickly because after these 30 minutes are up, there's no reversing this situation.
Are you going to resolve this now or do we need to proceed further?
If you decide to go ahead, I'll walk you through exactly how to buy the cards and provide the validation codes. Time is running out, Mr. Thompson.

I really appreciate your concern, but my wife needs to be involved in any decisions like this. We should hang up now and look at our records and maybe talk to a real tax advisor or call the IRS directly.
Thank you for trying to help, but something about all of this makes me uneasy. I'll take care of it properly, just not right now over the phone.
Let's end here, we need time to think this through properly.
